intro: Blepharis paradoxa, commonly known as the paradox grass, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, grass-like leaves and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its blooming period occurs during the summer months, producing clusters of pale blue or violet flowers. Blepharis paradoxa is often found in disturbed areas and is considered a short-lived perennial.
